result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marquez L Zeigler

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marquez L Zeigler in court, in custody.  Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court for Marquez L Zeigler.  Attorney William R. F. Ackell in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
Case set for Sentencing Hearing. Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Additional statement made by Nancy M. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by the parties. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.

AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 11 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, with credit for 175 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 5 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 6 YEARS.  

The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. The defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  

The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation to the State Department of Corrections for a period of 5 YEARS.  

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
Serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction with HUBER for work and school.
The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) and restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections and as a condition of probation/ extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY; random urine screens.
Mental Health Assessment and comply with treatment. 
Seek and maintain full-time employment.
Obtain HSED or GED. 
Perform 250 hours of community service at a non-profit charitable organization.
No contact with co-actors or victims of the offense.
Restitution in the amount of $6,271.81 payable to Christopher M. and $669.21 payable to Nancy M. Restitution is ordered / joint and several with co-actor William Brewer 22CF1908. 

The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he/she may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The defendant is advised that voting rights are suspended during length of sentence.
The defendant is advised of his/her appeal rights by defense counsel.

FILED: Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence

Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court for Marquez L Zeigler. Defendant Marquez L Zeigler not in court, in custody.  Attorney William R. F. Ackell in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
Case set for Sentencing Hearing. State request an adjournment for reasons presented to the Court. Defense does not object. Case adjourned, Branch 38.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 08:15 am.
filed.

filed.
filed.

Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court with Marquez L Zeigler. Defendant Marquez L Zeigler in court, in custody.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
Case set for Plea and Sentencing.  Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.  

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNTS 2 AND 3 dismissed and read-in for the purpose of sentencing. 

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire/Waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire and jury instruction received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Criminal Complaint/Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record. 

The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    
Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   

Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody. Case adjourned for sentencing hearing, branch 38.

e-FILED: Plea questionnaire/Waiver of rights; Addendum to plea questionnaire and waiver of rights; Jury Instructions
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  
AS TO COUNT 1: Court ordered charge amended to : ROBBERY (USE OF FORCE) - PTAC, AS A PARTY TO A CRIME, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.32(1)(a), 939.50(3)(e), 939.05, a Class E Felony.

Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING ( 28 pages) commencing 06-22-2022 by AMY DE LA ROSA.

Defendant Marquez L Zeigler in court, appear by video with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg, appear by video.  Defendant Marquez L Zeigler in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared appear by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Dectective M. Martin.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court, appear by video. Defendant Marquez L Zeigler not in court, in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witnss present. Due to court congestion, Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court, defendant Marquez L Zeigler not in court, in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. Court adjourn due to court conjecture. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Arial Rosenberg; filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Nancy M. (Victim); Christopher M. (Victim); Jatinder S. (Witness)
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered co-defs kept separate while in custody.

Defendant Marquez L Zeigler in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Marquez L Zeigler in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Marquez L Zeigler appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant has lower number case(s) pending.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
